summary: H.R. 4716 proposes transferring administrative jurisdiction of approximately 20.32 acres of federal land in Saratoga Springs, Utah, from the Secretary of the Interior to the United States Postal Service (USPS). The purpose of this transfer is for the USPS to construct and operate a post office on the specified land within two years of the bill's enactment. The bill specifies the location of the land and outlines the general transfer terms.
